### Staff Housing Assessment & Design - Southwest Northwest Territories Field Unit
#### Request for Proposal

Parks Canada Agency (PCA) invites submissions for a Building Science consultant firm to conduct an assessment and design for staff housing in the Southwest Northwest Territories Field Unit. The project involves generating documentation for energy retrofit and repair work on 14 houses in three remote communities, aiming to extend their service life, improve energy efficiency, and meet the Greening Government Strategy requirements.

#### Project Objective

* Assess and develop a comprehensive set of documents detailing energy retrofit and repair work necessary for the 14 houses
* Improve energy efficiency and meet Greening Government Strategy requirements
* Extend the service life of the houses and where possible, achieve Net Zero or Net Zero Ready status

#### Project Timeline

The project timeline is outlined in the attached Appendix D, which provides a detailed schedule.

#### Bidder’s Conference

A virtual bidder’s conference will be held on January 9, 2023, from 1:30 PM MST. The conference will review the project scope and answer questions. It is recommended that interested bidders participate to ensure a smooth bidding process.

#### Submission Requirements

Submissions should include all the required documents as outlined in the solicitation. The maximum email file size accepted by Parks Canada is 15 megabytes. Please ensure that the email and attachments do not exceed this size.

#### Enquiries

All technical and contractual enquiries should be submitted in writing via email to the Contracting Authority at least eight business days prior to the tender closing date. The only accepted email address for responses to proposal solicitations is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.

#### Tender Closing Date

February 28, 2023, at 4:00 PM local time

#### Important Notes

* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* National Parks Regulations require all work to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
* Bidders are responsible for ensuring compliance with these regulations and all other laws applicable to the project.
